text:
Candidates with the appointment orders they received from Ministers S.P. Velumani (fourth right),P. Mohan (fifth right) and P. Thangamani (seventh right), at the private job fair organised by the government in Coimbatore on Sunday.- Photo: M. Periasamy

Nearly 150 companies from our member associations participated in the fair. Some companies managed to fill up vacancies and also build a list for their future requirementsD. Nandakumar,President of the Indian Chamber of Commerce and Industry, Coimbatore

he State Government’s efforts to establish new companies have created lakhs of jobs in over the last four-and-a-half years, according to Industries Minister P. Thangamani.

Speaking at the private job fair organised by the Government here on Sunday, the Minister said that the government has created more than a lakh jobs directly and more than 5 lakh jobs indirectly, since May 2011.

Referring to criticisms about the Global Investor Meet in September last year, he said that land has been allotted to 50 per cent of the companies that had signed MoUs with the Government and these units would establish facilities soon. “They will generate five lakh more jobs in the State,” he added.

Minister for Rural Industries P. Mohan highlighted the efforts taken by the government to provide more jobs and benefits extended to industries.

Talking about the fair, Minister for Municipal Administration and Rural Development S.P. Velumani said that various government departments have been working hard for more than a month to organise it.

He said that 2.6 lakh candidates had registered to take part in the fair and more than 50,000 had directly registered at the fair venue.

The ministers also handed over appointment orders to many successful candidates.

According to a press release from the district administration appointment orders were issued to 10,155 candidates on Sunday. While 938 candidates registered for overseas jobs, 14,503 candidates enrolled to undergo training in skill-based courses offered by the government.

Nearly 150 companies from our member associations participated in the fair. Some companies managed to fill up vacancies and also build a list for their future requirements

D. Nandakumar,President of the Indian Chamber of Commerce and Industry, Coimbatore
title: ‘Five lakh jobs to be generated in State’
